definitions: moving or directed toward the opponent's goal or end of the playing field in sports
examples: The quarterback threw the ball downfield to the receiver
The runners sprinted downfield after the kickoff

definitions: moving or leading toward the bottom of a slope or incline
deteriorating progressively or becoming easier in a negative sense
examples: The downhill path made walking much easier
We enjoyed the downhill ski runs all morning
Everything went downhill after the company merger
His health has been going downhill for months

definitions: absolute and unqualified; used as an intensifier to emphasize the extent of something
examples: His behavior was downright rude and unacceptable
The weather has been downright miserable this week

definitions: situated on or relating to a lower floor or level of a building
examples: The downstairs bathroom needs renovation this year
We heard noises from the downstairs neighbors

definitions: moving or situated in the direction toward which a river or stream flows
occurring later in a process or system, especially in business or manufacturing
examples: The downstream villages were warned about flooding
We found a campsite downstream from the bridge
Downstream processing affects the final product quality
The downstream effects of this decision are significant

definitions: treated badly by people in power and denied opportunities or freedoms
examples: The downtrodden workers finally organized a union
She championed the rights of the downtrodden masses

definitions: moving or extending from a higher to a lower place or level
examples: The downward trend in prices continued through winter
She made a downward gesture with her hand

definitions: situated or moving in the direction toward which the wind is blowing
examples: We stayed downwind to avoid the smoke
The downwind position gave us an advantage

definitions: covered with or resembling soft fine feathers or hair; fluffy and soft
examples: The baby bird had downy feathers on its chest
She rested her head on the downy pillow

definitions: amounting to twelve in number as a specific quantity or approximate amount
examples: She bought a dozen eggs from the market
We invited about a dozen friends to dinner

definitions: lacking brightness of color; dull gray or brown in appearance
lacking excitement or interest; drearily monotonous and unstimulating
examples: The drab military uniforms blended into the landscape
She painted the drab walls a cheerful yellow
His drab existence changed when he met her
The presentation was drab and failed to engage

definitions: continuing for too long and seeming to pass very slowly
examples: The dragging pace of the meeting frustrated everyone
It was a dragging afternoon with nothing to do

definitions: having had liquid removed or having flowed out completely
depleted of physical or emotional energy; extremely tired
examples: The drained swimming pool needed major repairs
He checked the drained oil from the engine
She felt completely drained after the long shift
The drained expression on his face worried her

definitions: causing physical or emotional exhaustion; using up energy or resources
examples: The draining work schedule affected her health
It was an emotionally draining conversation about loss

definitions: sudden and striking in effect; making a strong impression through contrast or intensity
relating to drama or the performance of plays; theatrical
examples: The dramatic increase in sales surprised everyone
She made a dramatic entrance at the party
His dramatic training showed in every performance
The dramatic arts program attracted many students

definitions: covered or decorated with cloth or clothing hanging in loose folds
examples: The draped furniture protected it during renovation
She wore a beautifully draped silk dress

definitions: likely to have a strong or far-reaching effect; extreme and dramatic in nature
examples: The company took drastic measures to cut costs
Such drastic changes require careful consideration

definitions: stretched or pulled tight; extended to full length
showing signs of strain, fatigue, or suffering in facial appearance
examples: The drawn curtains blocked out all sunlight
He kept his sword drawn throughout the battle
Her drawn face showed the stress she endured
He looked drawn after working all night

definitions: regarded with great fear or apprehension; causing anxiety or terror
examples: The dread disease claimed many lives that year
He received the dread news about his diagnosis

definitions: regarded with great fear, apprehension, or reluctance; greatly disliked
examples: The dreaded exam finally arrived on Monday
She received another dreaded call from her boss

definitions: extremely bad, unpleasant, or of very poor quality
causing or involving great fear or suffering; terrible or frightening
examples: The dreadful weather ruined our vacation plans
His singing was absolutely dreadful
They survived a dreadful accident on the highway
The dreadful news shocked the entire community

definitions: conceived of or imagined, especially as an ideal or perfect scenario
examples: She finally got her dreamed promotion this year
They built their long dreamed house by the lake

definitions: having the characteristics of a dream; strange, ethereal, or seeming unreal
examples: The foggy morning created a dreamlike atmosphere
She moved through the day in a dreamlike state

definitions: having a magical or pleasantly unreal quality; delightfully vague
having a distracted or unfocused quality; given to daydreaming
examples: The dreamy music created a romantic atmosphere
She had a dreamy smile on her face
He had a dreamy expression during the lecture
Her dreamy nature made her forget appointments

definitions: dull, bleak, and lifeless; causing feelings of sadness or depression
examples: The dreary weather matched her melancholy mood
They spent a dreary afternoon doing paperwork

definitions: thoroughly wet; saturated or soaked completely with water or liquid
examples: The drenched hikers sought shelter from the storm
Her drenched clothes clung uncomfortably to her body

definitions: wearing clothes, especially of a specified type or manner
prepared, treated, or finished in a particular way
examples: The dressed guests arrived at the formal dinner
She was dressed in her finest evening gown
The dressed lumber was ready for construction
They served dressed salad with fresh herbs

definitions: preserved by having moisture removed through evaporation or dehydration
having lost natural moisture; no longer wet or fresh
examples: She added dried herbs to the pasta sauce
The dried fruit makes a healthy snack
The dried riverbed revealed ancient fossils
His dried lips cracked in the desert heat

definitions: moving slowly and smoothly without direction or control
examples: The drifting clouds changed shapes across the sky
Drifting snow blocked the mountain roads

definitions: trained intensively through repeated practice or instruction
examples: The well drilled soldiers performed flawlessly
Her drilled responses showed excellent preparation

definitions: safe and suitable for drinking; potable
pleasant or acceptable in taste when consumed as a beverage
examples: The water treatment made the river water drinkable
They tested whether the well water was drinkable
This wine is quite drinkable despite its low price
The coffee was barely drinkable after sitting out

definitions: having a compulsive or urgent quality; strongly motivated to succeed
examples: The driven executive worked eighty hours weekly
Her driven personality helped her achieve her goals

definitions: having great force or energy; vigorous and powerful in effect
examples: The driving rain forced us to seek shelter
Her driving ambition propelled her to success

definitions: curious or unusual in a way that provokes dry amusement
examples: His droll sense of humor entertained everyone
She made a droll observation about office politics

definitions: bending or hanging downward, typically from tiredness or weakness
examples: The drooping flowers needed water desperately
His drooping eyelids showed his exhaustion

definitions: hanging down limply; lacking firmness or vigor
examples: The dog's droopy ears made him look sad
Her droopy eyes indicated she needed sleep

definitions: falling downward or decreasing in level, amount, or intensity
examples: The dropping temperatures signaled winter's arrival
Dropping sales concerned the company's board

definitions: feeling sleepy and lacking energy; half asleep
examples: The drowsy student struggled to stay awake
The warm afternoon made everyone feel drowsy

definitions: affected by or as if by a drug; in a stupefied state
examples: His drugged state made communication impossible
She felt drugged after taking the medication

definitions: affected by alcohol to the extent of losing control of faculties
overwhelmed or intoxicated by a strong emotion or sensation
examples: The drunk driver was arrested immediately
He was too drunk to walk straight
She was drunk with power after the promotion
They were drunk on their unexpected success

definitions: showing the effects of or characterized by drunkenness or excessive drinking
examples: His drunken behavior embarrassed his family
They heard drunken singing from the tavern

definitions: free from moisture or liquid; not wet or moist
lacking emotion, warmth, or enthusiasm in expression
prohibiting the sale or consumption of alcoholic beverages
lacking interest or stimulation; dull and uninteresting
examples: The dry desert stretched for miles ahead
Keep the bandage clean and dry
Her dry response revealed no emotional attachment
He delivered the news in a dry tone
They lived in a dry county in Arkansas
The restaurant was dry on Sundays
The dry lecture put half the students to sleep
His dry presentation lacked any enthusiasm

definitions: consisting of two parts, elements, or aspects
examples: The smartphone has dual cameras for better photos
She has dual citizenship in two countries

definitions: characterized by or based on the division into two opposed or contrasting aspects
examples: His dualistic thinking oversimplified complex issues
The dualistic nature of the theory was problematic

definitions: hesitating or doubting; not to be relied upon
morally suspect or of questionable value or propriety
examples: She was dubious about the investment opportunity
His dubious claims raised many questions
The company engaged in dubious business practices
That's a dubious way to handle the situation

definitions: able to be deformed without losing toughness; capable of being drawn into wire
examples: Gold is highly ductile and can be stretched
The ductile metal was perfect for manufacturing

definitions: failing to work or meet expectations; ineffective or useless
examples: The dud firecracker didn't explode as expected
Their dud investment lost money every quarter

definitions: required to be paid or returned at a specific time
expected to happen, arrive, or be completed at a particular time
proper, appropriate, or deserved under the circumstances
examples: The rent is due on the first of each month
Payment is due within thirty days
The train is due at three o'clock
She's due to give birth next week
Give credit where credit is due
After due consideration, we accepted the offer

definitions: lacking brightness, vividness, or sheen
not sharp; having a blunt edge or point
lacking interest or excitement; boring
slow to understand or perceive; lacking quickness of mind
examples: The dull paint needed a fresh coat
It was a dull gray morning
The dull knife couldn't cut the bread
The pencil point had become dull
The dull lecture lasted three hours
It was a dull party with no entertainment
He seemed dull and couldn't grasp simple concepts
Her dull responses frustrated the teacher

definitions: lacking the ability to speak, especially as a congenital condition
lacking intelligence or good judgment; stupid
temporarily unable or unwilling to speak
examples: The dumb animals couldn't voice their suffering
Sign language helps dumb children communicate
That was a really dumb mistake to make
Don't be dumb about your finances
He was struck dumb by her beauty
The shocking news left everyone dumb
